**Responsibilities**
* Outreach to prospective leads of target accounts by mainly email and LinkedIn, but also via phone and in-person to develop new business opportunities
* Effective use of Outreach.io, HubSpot, Excel and other tools to run leads and accounts through every step of the sales cycle
* Manage initial management of inbound and outbound generated leads
* Explain the value of Columbia Road's services to potential and current customers, as well as senior executives
* Achieve meeting targets as set by the Stockholm sales & marketing team


**Who We Are**
 Columbia Road's Stockholm office is a team of 19 talented individuals with ambitious growth targets and eagerness to show the market the potential of data, great customer experience and a solid tech foundation. Columbia Road group is much larger, with 2 more offices located in Helsinki and Tampere, Finland. In total, we are over 150 Roadies representing more than 25 nationalities and our official language is English.
   

  

 Our company spirit is one of a true start-up with a twist of hard-core experience. Instead of line managers and red tape, we believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.
   

  

 Columbia Road's focus on digital sales means we are tackling many types of projects - some of the main platforms we actively work on are Adobe, HubSpot, Salesforce, Shopify and Dynamics, but we also support our clients outside of these platforms.
   

  

 For more details on projects, see our reference cases HERE or check out our blog HERE. Find out more about working with us by visiting our careers page or taking a look at our Culture Code.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You should have some work experience in sales or outbound contacting
* Personal interest in sales development, digital consulting, and initiating outbound contacting and appointment making
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Great attention to detail
* Process-oriented work manner
* Ability to take ownership of your work, and good teamwork skills
* Technical understanding of the digital sales and marketing landscape and tools
* Previous experience working at a rapidly growing company is a bonus


 Location: We value close and constant collaboration in our team work - whether it's with customers, fellow Roadies and/or consultants from other companies - as it enables us to learn from each other and work more efficiently towards a shared goal. Often this is achieved best by working from the same location. Hence, we can only consider candidates who live (or plan to move) within commuting distance of Stockholm.
   

  

 Note: We are currently unable to offer visa sponsorships for Sweden, so, unfortunately, we can't consider applications from outside the EU/EEA. To succeed in this role, you should have full professional proficiency in Swedish and excellent written and oral skills in English.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
 The recruitment process usually has 2-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.
   

  

 We're committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.
   

  

 When we're done with the face-to-face discussions, we'll contact the people you have chosen as references.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Office in central Stockholm (Drottninggatan 33)
* Preferred choice from a selection of market-level (or above) equipment
* Private Health Care
* Mobile phone subscription
* Daily breakfasts & healthy daily refreshments
* A yearly bonus based on company performance
* A community-led organization with a high level of autonomy
* As a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share program
* Recurring training & learning sessions to support your professional growth
* A diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace
* Recurring Roadie-ideated events and activities
* Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time


 Please look at our Culture Code to get to know us better!

title: Operations Enablement Specialist
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Operational Product Experience team**





 Join our dynamic Operational Product Experience team, dedicated to enhancing data and tooling capabilities! Our mission is clear: we're relentlessly improving internal tooling infrastructure critical for business processes, ensuring scalability to drive market growth. Through data-driven strategies, collaborative efforts across departments, and equipping teams with cutting-edge tools and insights, we're at the forefront of innovation. If you're passionate about accountability, innovation, and customer-centricity, come be a part of Trustly's Operations organisation's success story!
 








**About the role** 





 Are you passionate about shaping the future of our Operations to drive business growth? We are now looking for a proactive and strategic Operations Enablement Specialist to join our operational product experience team. As a vital part of our team, you will play a key role in ensuring our operations run seamless and efficiently,  contributing directly to high-impact strategic projects that drive our company's success. You will work closely with the director of Operational products, Operations leadership and the Chief Operations Officer, playing a key role in ensuring operational readiness related to product launches and drive process improvements.
 





  




**what you will do** 
* Lead and participate in operational readiness initiatives to prepare our operational teams for new product launches or process changes
* Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely and successful product launch and project delivery
* Conduct post-launch product performance monitoring and data-driven analysis to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement
* Work closely with product, engineering, customer success, and other teams to ensure alignment on product requirements, timelines, and operational needs
* Define and implement operational processes, product improvements and solutions focusing on efficiency, scalability, and cost-effectiveness
* Identify operational improvement opportunities and implement solutions
* Develop and maintain clear and effective process documentation
* Develop process documentation, training materials and conduct ongoing coaching to empower colleagues with the knowledge and skills needed to deliver exceptional service



  




**Who you are** 
* At least 3 years of experience in product operations, operations management, process improvement or a related field
* Strong in project management and problem-solving skills
* An excellent communicator, capable of articulating findings and recommendations clearly to stakeholders at all levels, with strong presentation skills
* A collaborative team player who thrives in a fast paced environment with excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and departments
* Highly accountable, consistently delivering on commitments, and striving for excellence in everything you do with a customer-centric mindset
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our processes, products and tools.
* Knowledge and understanding of online payments and experience working with customer service in Payments, E-com, or Financial Services is a plus
* Proficient in English, both spoken and written






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Business Operations Associate
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience to entrepreneurs? We are hiring for a committed
 **Business Operations Associate** 
 to join our dynamic team!
 



  





**About Froda** 




 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission – to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy for business owners to invest in their ideas.
 



  





**About the role** 




 In this role, you will be the first point of contact for our customers, essential in providing high-quality support and contributing to their overall satisfaction. Your talent for understanding customer needs, coupled with your problem-solving skills, will not only resolve their issues but also enrich their experience with Froda.
 



  





**You will** 



* Deliver exceptional customer service via email, and phone.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve customer issues efficiently.
* Provide product and service information, highlighting features beneficial to customers.
* Collaborate with other teams to ensure a consistent and high-quality customer experience.
* Collect and report customer feedback to aid in enhancing our services.



  





**Who you are** 



* You possess excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.
* Experience in customer service, support, or a similar role is preferred.
* You have an empathetic approach to handling customer queries and complaints.
* Able to multitask and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* You are tech-savvy and comfortable navigating customer support platforms and tools.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 Working at Froda is everything you can expect from working at a tech scale: fun and fast-paced. We are 80+ ambitious people who work together mostly at the office, with few scheduled meetings. The culture is friendly, with a get-shit-done attitude. At Froda, you will truly have freedom under responsibility. This means that you will have the ability to impact your own work and tackle a wider set of tasks.
 



  





 Furthermore, you’ll get:
 


* Fun & exciting work environment in a fast-growing and profitable scale-up
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan
* The possibility to work in our awesome office in Stockholm
* Friendly culture that values work/life balance
* Monthly after-works that are actually fun



  





 If you're passionate about delivering unparalleled customer service and want to be part of our mission to redefine the banking experience for entrepreneurs, apply to join us as a Business Operations Associate today!

title: Senior FP&A Solution Consulting Nordics (CPM / BPM / EPM)
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering a Business Platform with ERP, FP&A, HCM and Procurement that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Our job in Solution Consulting is to understand our customers’ business challenges and to accurately show how Unit4 solutions can solve these challenges. To attain the best possible solution, you will spend time researching and discovering the customer’s challenges and goals.
   

  

* You will understand the customer, and challenge them, and become their voice in the sales process.
* You will delight and inspire our customers to help build and deliver their desired end goals.
* You are a trusted advisor who will naturally lead our customers and colleagues; you adapt, plan and mobilise people.
* You will be an expert in Unit4 solutions, you will understand and sell the value of Unit4solutions and why Unit4 is different to other suppliers in the marketplace.
* You love technology and you are driven to find the best possible solutions for our customers.
* Your expertise is what sets you apart from other roles in sales, customers will trust your advice and Unit4 professional services will believe in the vision you create for customers during the bid stages.
* The role will join and support the Nordics region and, as part of a global team, support all regions of the business on all FP&A solution consulting requirements from RFPs through to custom demo builds, through to demo delivery and presentations.


**Qualifications**
* FP&A / CPM / BPM / EPM presales / solution consulting / consulting experience.
* A professional financial qualification and/or relevant experience in the office of finance is desirable.
* Fluent Business level local languages and good English
* Technical FP&A / CPM / BPM / EPM experience and capabilities to model based on business requirements.
* You have a proven ability to create and deliver engaging solutions supported by excellent presentation and written skills.
* Demonstrable analytical skills and problem solving ability.
* You are an excellent communicator, have a good sense of humour and enjoy working in a team environment.
* You have the ability to build rapport within the organization and with external stakeholders at all levels.
* Previous experience or understanding of the wider Unit4 offerings is desirable, but not essential.


**Additional Information**
 Join Unit4 and you’ll be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud software space today. We’re a fast-paced and high-growth people-centric cloud player offering a host of benefits & development opportunities for individuals serious about their career
   

  

* Work, learn & be inspired by some of the best talent in the software space
* Whole host of great benefits & perks, including uncapped time off!
* Talent program for high performers. Each year we provide a platform for high potential talent to accelerate their careers!
* Committed to corporate social responsibility with our Act4Good initiative, our global movement to do good, and a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society
* Diversity4U. Helping our people thrive starts with a safe and inclusive work environment. We launched our Diversity4U program that builds on our “be genuine” value


 Enterprise software: ERP, FP&A, S2C, HCM - Unit4
   

  

 Unit4 is an enterprise software suite, including finance management, accounting, ERP, FP&A, S2C, HCM and talent management modules.

title: Assistant Store Manager i Kungsholmen (Maternity Cover) BOLIA
description:
**Vi drivs av att skapa en utvecklande medarbetarkultur, starka resultat och en speciell kundupplevelse. Låter det som något för dig så letar vi nu efter en Store Manager (Maternity Cover) till vår vackra konceptbutik i Kungsholmen.**
**Om jobbet**
 Som Assistant Store Manager blir du ambassadör för Bolia. Du sätter en stor ära i att erbjuda superbrandservice på butiksgolvet samtidigt som du har förmågan att fungera som en förebild för ditt team. Du leder arbetet och ser till att butiken når sina mål, och dina framgångar avspeglas i dina kollegors framgångar och den höga standarden på butiken, där du har förmågan att driva både försäljning, KPI:er, utbildning och ledning.
   

  

**Dina Uppgifter**
* Säkerställa extraordinära kundupplevelser för alla besökare.
* Säkerställa att både dina egna och teamets försäljningsmål uppfylls.
* Säkerställa optimal bemanningsplanering med SMART Planning
* Säkerställa en inspirerande och välkomnande butik genom implementering av VM-riktlinjer.
* Ledning och planering av alla dagliga rutiner och uppgifter, inklusive försäljnings- och budgetansvar.
* Leda teamet genom att föregå med gott exempel och synlighet.
* Utveckla, motivera och leda dina medarbetare så att de når sina personliga försäljnings- och utvecklingsmål genom månatliga uppföljningsmöten och årliga medarbetarutvecklingssamtal.
* Ansvara för all butiks-HR samt att säkerställa en öppen, vänlig och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
* Ansvara för att rekrytera nya Bolia-talanger och behålla medarbetare liksom för onboarding och eventuella uppsägningar.
* Utveckling, implementering och uppföljning av kvartalsvisa actionplans.
* Hålla dig själv och teamet uppdaterade när det gäller all information från olika kommunikationsplattformar.


**Dina Kompetenser**
* Du har lång erfarenhet från en ledande befattning, helst inom retail.
* Du har en hands-on-mentalitet och kan gå i täten när det gäller alla typer av uppgifter.
* Du har erfarenhet av att sammanställa och utveckla ett team, och på så vis skapa goda resultat.
* Du är bra på att kommunicera och motivera dina medarbetare
* Du är initiativrik, tar ansvar och arbetar strukturerat.
* Du har god förmåga att planera, genomföra och slutföra uppgifter.
* Du är inte rädd för att delegera, men deltar även gärna själv i uppgiften.
* Du talar och skriver engelska på minst samtalsnivå.
* Du behärskar Office-paketet väl och dina it-kunskaper ligger på hög nivå.
* God it-förståelse är generellt en fördel eftersom vi är ett digitalt företag som använder många olika och komplexa program.


**Bolia som arbetsplats**
 Som Store Manager i en Bolia-butik får du ett inspirerande och meningsfullt jobb med fart och fläkt. Bolia-kulturen bygger på en proaktiv inställning där alla känner sig involverade i processer och beslut – och inte minst inspirerade att ta på sig ansvaret för varandra, våra kunder och världen omkring oss. Som manager på Bolia spelar du en bärande roll för denna kultur.
   

  

 På Bolia arbetar vi efter filosofin ”Always in Beta”. Vi har ambitionen att ta aktiv del i den globala hållbara utvecklingen och samtidigt dela med oss av vår kreativitet och passion för att göra bättre val. Vi älskar att utmana vanor och stagnation genom en strävan att hitta nya vägar som gör oss klokare, bättre, gladare och mer hållbara.
   

  

**Vill du följa med resan?**
 Vi hoppas att du har fått svar på dina frågor, men har du några frågor kvar är du välkommen att kontakta Store Manager på Mail (Maternity Cover). Ladda upp ansökan och CV via länken.
   

  

 Vi håller intervjuer fortlöpande och rekommenderar därför att du skickar in din ansökan redan idag. Platsannonsen tas bort så snart vi har fått in tillräckligt många ansökningar eller när rätt kandidat har hittats. Självklart behandlar vi din ansökan konfidentiellt.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och skapa något alldeles unikt tillsammans.
   

  

**Om Bolia**
 Vi är födda i Danmark med naturen och det skandinaviska designarvet som vår största inspiration. Och när vi arbetar är det med kreativitet, innovation och hållbarhet i fokus. Vi tar vårt ansvar på allvar och varje dag lägger vi fokus på att fatta ansvarsfulla beslut både vad gäller hållbarhet och kultur. Vi arbetar målinriktat för att skapa en inkluderande kultur med ännu mer mångfald som representerar olika bakgrunder, perspektiv och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Du hittar vårt huvudkontor i Aarhus, Danmark och våra konceptbutiker i stora delar av Europa. Vi är ett globalt företag, men vi är inget traditionellt möbelföretag. Vi skapar designföremål och speciella upplevelser som inte bara begränsar sig till design. Därför har vi ett alldeles eget sound, ekologiskt kaffe och vår egen doft.
   

  

 Besök vårt designuniversum där du kan känna dig som hemma, drömma och gå på upptäcktsfärd i vår vackra och lugna miljö. Hitta din närmaste butik eller träffa oss på www.Bolia.com .

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Spend Management
description:
Engineers are the backbone of all we do at Pleo. Without these wildly brilliant people, we don’t have a thing. We are looking for an experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join one of our cross-functional product teams.
   

  

 As a Senior we trust you to be an expert in server-side languages. Kotlin is 90%+ of our micro-services, so proficiency here is hugely beneficial. Beyond writing excellent, well-tested, maintainable code, you also practice the other aspects of being a strong technical leader. You give insightful PR reviews, are a trusted technical partner to teammates, know when/how to prioritise tech debt, proactively jump into P1/P2 incidents, lead post-mortems and can generally upskill and unblock the team around you.
   

  

 But it’s not just about being a master of your craft; it’s about ownership and taking the lead on large projects. These could be new product launches, managing tricky migrations, and designing and building new microservices or components.
   

  

 As a scale-up, we sometimes need to shift focus. When that happens, your role is to be a steady hand to help the team navigate ambiguity and manage technical change.
   

  

 Mostly, we’re looking for someone others can look up to and learn from. You’ll set the standard for the team, not just with your code but in how you work and the culture you promote. At Pleo, our people and our culture are very important to us, and we value trust and transparency like you wouldn’t believe.
   

  

 And finally, we want to enjoy what we do and who we are working with because duh.
   

  

 You know your way around
   

  

* Server-side languages (we mostly use Kotlin, with few services in TypeScript)
* Cloud environments/ distributed systems/ microservices (AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
* Relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL)
* Testing frameworks (Cypress, JUnit, Testcontainers)
* Observability and monitoring (Datadog)
* DevOps culture and tools (GitHub Actions, Gradle, Terraform)


 Your colleagues would say you
   

  

* Work in English with ease (it's our company language)
* Never stop being curious and love learning about new languages/ frameworks/ working styles
* Have experience solving complex technical challenges at scale
* Ensure a high bar for quality and reliability within your team
* Coach others to help them develop as engineers
* Advocate for a more thorough code review process than a quick scroll to the bottom of the page and a “LGTM!”
* You don’t just write code; you help to design the overall solution
* Are sought after within your team for help in solving challenging problems
* You’re a force multiplier within your team - your work enables other engineers to do be even better
* Able to raise and describe technical debt faced by your team. And then able to propose a solution or path forward


 Show me the benefits!
   

  

* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Flexible working remote options
* Lunch catered in our London, Copenhagen and Lisbon offices
* 25 days of holiday per year + your local public holidays
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶🏻
* 


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Bolagsekonom sökes till vår kund i centrala Stockholm
company: Eqonomy - en del av Wise Professionals
description:
Bolagsekonom för uppdrag centralt i Stockholm City! Uppdraget planeras tillsättas under september och pågår under ett år.
   

  

 Vi söker en bolagsekonom för ett expansivt tjänstebolag inom management och IT med en central placering i Stockholm City, Norrmalm. Bolaget befinner sig just nu i en stor förändring och vi ser gärna att du vill vara med på resan!
   

  

 Placering: Stockholm City, Norrmalm
   

  

 Startdatum: September
   

  

 Varaktighet: Uppdrag på ett år
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som bolagsekonom är din huvudsakliga uppgift att hantera och sammanställa redovisningen för de enskilda juridiska enheterna (dotterbolagen) inom koncernen. Du kommer också att ansvara för momsdeklarationer och årsredovisningar för dessa enheter, och därigenom spela en nyckelroll för att säkerställa korrekta finansiella rapporter och efterlevnad av regelverk och standarder.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Redovisning för moderbolag och dotterbolag: Du kommer att ansvara för att hantera och sammanställa redovisningen för de olika bolagen inom koncernen. Det är av yttersta vikt att redovisningen är korrekt och följer interna riktlinjer och externa krav.
* Momsdeklaration: Du förväntas förbereda och lämna in momsdeklarationer för de juridiska enheterna i enlighet med gällande lagar och föreskrifter. Detta inkluderar att säkerställa korrekt beräkning av moms samt att rapportera och betala in moms i tid.
* Årsredovisningar: Ansvar för att förbereda och sammanställa årsredovisningar för de juridiska enheterna. Detta innefattar att samla in och konsolidera finansiell information, upprätta balansräkningar, resultaträkningar och tillhörande noter i enlighet med lagkrav och koncernens riktlinjer.
* Effektiviseringsprojekt: Genomförande av effektiviseringsprojekt inom redovisningen för att förbättra processer och öka produktiviteten. Detta kan innebära identifiering och implementering av automatiserade lösningar för rutinmässiga uppgifter samt utveckling och optimering av arbetsflöden.
* Support till dotterbolagen: Fungera som en central kontaktpunkt för dotterbolagen avseende redovisningsfrågor och ge support och vägledning vid behov.
* Projektredovisning: Uppföljning av projekt för att säkerställa korrekt fördelning av intäkter och kostnader mellan bolagen och konsulter.
* Hantering av slutavräkning: Tillsammans med löneavdelningen hantera beräkning och säkerställa slutavräkning för utbetalning till medarbetare.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Erfaren inom redovisning från reskontra till bokslut och årsredovisning.
* Noggrannhet och intresse för att utveckla processer och rutiner
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Maconomy, Visma Bokslut och Visma Skatt
* Starka Excel-kunskaper
* Driv och engagemang


 Om du är en erfaren redovisningsekonom med intresse för att utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö, ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**När du blir en av oss**
 Som konsult hos Eqonomy/Wise Professionals erbjuds du alltid en marknadsmässig lön, friskvårdsbidrag, pensionsavsättning och anslutning till vårt kollektivavtal – inget är viktigare för oss än att du känner dig trygg i din anställning. På samma sätt som vi ställer höga krav på dig som konsult förväntar vi oss också att du ställer höga krav på oss som arbetsgivare. Oavsett vart du befinner dig i din karriär så ska konsultrollen hos Eqonomy/Wise Professionals ge dig kunskap och erfarenhet som du kan bära med dig på vägen till nästa spännande utmaning.
   

  

**Om du vill veta mer**
 Har du frågor om rollen kontakta hanna.linde@wise.se. För att söka rollen klicka på ”sök rollen”, samt bifoga CV. Notera att personligt brev inte är obligatoriskt i denna ansökningsprocess. I konsultvärlden går saker ofta snabbt så tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Vänta därför inte med din ansökan, varmt välkommen att söka!
   

  

 Ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Trainee Technical Project Management
description:
Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. Unrivaled pioneering spirit and a strong commitment towards a more sustainable future. That’s what we offer. Today, we are Europe’s largest renewable energy producer and employ more than 6.000 colleagues in 20+ countries around the world. Our vision is clear - to renew the way the world is powered. But there is more work to be done and that is why we need you to help us.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Our trainee programme is a unique entry point into the world of renewables. During your time as a trainee, you will work on some of the toughest challenges within the energy sector, collaborate with some of the smartest minds in the industry, be offered world-class development and learning opportunities and be part of an exclusive network of ambitious young talents from across the world. You will also get the opportunity to apply for a seat on our CEO-led Future Board initiative – an advisory board made up of trainees and young professionals at Statkraft. Have we caught your attention?
   





**As a Trainee in our Technical Project Management department you will:**



* **Engage in every phase of the project lifecycle** 
 : From initial pre-study to hands-on execution and final handover to operations, all in line with the Statkraft project model
* **Collaborate across diverse technical fields:** 
 Support and coordinate activities spanning multiple domains, ensuring a dynamic and varied work experience
* **Drive project success:** 
 Plan, track, and report on project goals, timelines, resource usage, risk management, and budgets in collaboration with project managers
* **Enhance project portfolio reporting:** 
 Contribute to comprehensive reporting, offering a holistic view of the project portfolio
* **Ensure compliance and excellence:** 
 Maintain project adherence to internal standards, ensuring high-quality outcomes



*Please note that the home base for this role will be in Stockholm, Sweden.*



**Qualifications**

 We are looking for recent graduates who are motivated to join us in leading the green energy transition. Below are some qualifications we believe are beneficial as a trainee at Statkraft:
   




* Master’s degree within relevant area of Engineering (Energy, Electrical, Mechanical) or similar
* No more than one year of work experience post education (excluding internships/part-time jobs)
* Strong and proven ability to collaborate with others and work as a team player
* Curious and open minded towards different tasks and work environments
* Open to relocate during your trainee program for a period of 6 months
* Fluency in English is required, also basic Swedish (other European languages are an asset)


**Additional Information**

**About the programme - What to expect?**




 Being a trainee at Statkraft is a unique experience for every graduate! You will immediately explore different parts of the renewable energy business and experience our vision – to renew the way the world is powered – in action. We do not just talk about new solutions for tackling the climate crisis but we are working actively to lead the energy transition towards a more sustainable future.
   





 At Statkraft, young talents such as our trainees are an important part of our company`s culture and have always been since more than 20 years. It is part of our DNA to develop future leaders and expert in the field of renewable energy. This programme is both, an opportunity for the next generation to build exciting and relevant careers while challenge our company’s ways of thinking.
   





**Our trainee positions include the following:**



* A 16-month programme including three rotations, one of them abroad
* Opportunity to experience different roles and placements across the organization
* Competitive salaries and benefits
* Opportunity\* to participate in our CEO-led Future Board (An initiative developed to offer young talents the opportunity to advise our CEO and Executive Management on strategic projects)
 *\*Successful application for the programme required*
* Tailored professional and social programmes for all trainees
* Guaranteed permanent employment upon completion of the programme



*If you are interested to learn more about the programme, its structure and benefits we recommend to check out our website: statkraft.com/trainee*




**Good to know:**



* ****Trainee Program Start Date:****
 September 1st 2025
* ****Application Deadline** 
 :** 
 September 30th 2024 (Kindly note, that we will review all applications after this deadline to ensure equal conditions for all applicants)
* ****Application Documents:****
 Please provide us with your CV and latest transcripts
* ****Assessment Day:****
 Kindly note, that you will need to be available for our digital assessment day which will most likely take place during November 04.-06th 2024
* ****Any questions?****
 Please reach out to careers@statkraft.com



*Our vision is to renew the way the world is powered. To navigate the complex journey ahead, we need every voice at the table. We therefore work actively to be a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome all applicants regardless of background, gender, age, sexual orientation, religious belief, ethnicity, nationality or disability.*




*Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.*




*We manage critical infrastructure and services in several countries. All applicants must therefore be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.*

title: 2025 Global Private Bank - Advisor Summer Internship Program - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**2025 Global Private Bank - Summer Internship Program – Stockholm**
 If you enjoy building relationships and helping develop innovative solutions while working in a fast-paced environment, then we have the role for you. Our advisors help clients achieve their financial goals by delivering the right solutions and services across our industry leading investments, credit, banking and Trust & Estates practices. This individualized attention supports our clients' unique goals and helps build, preserve and manage their wealth over time.
   

  

 As an Advisor Summer Intern in the Global Private Bank, you will have what you need to succeed – from training and mentorship from senior executives to projects that engage all your skills. As a future Advisor, you'll work with our team of advisors and specialists to bring in new clients and to serve existing ones. We deliver highly customized and comprehensive solutions to help protect, manage and grow wealth. No client has identical goals, so understanding their unique needs and tailoring our approach to exceed expectations requires work across teams and the firm to provide first-class service.
   

  

 Our nine-week program kicks off with a week of induction, where you'll have training and orientation to our businesses and gain the technical and practical knowledge you'll need to start contributing to our teams. Joining our Summer Internship Program means you will be joining a team committed to building client relationships and making meaningful contributions to our business with customized wealth management solutions. Working here means joining a collaborative, supportive team. We want your diverse perspective to help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions for our clients. Top performers may receive a full-time offer at the end of the summer.
   

  

  

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Work with our teams to understand client needs and examine market activities to develop and execute strategies that help clients meet their financial goals
* Work with a team of bankers, investment specialists, wealth advisors, and lending specialists. Throughout the summer, you'll learn about our business and our clients while building your own expertise
* Collaborate with various teams, including but not limited to market strategy, equity, and alternative investment teams to conduct research and analysis, develop products and respond to client needs as part of a Solutions Team
* Continuously learn through one-on-one mentorship, learning sessions and ongoing events to grow your professional network


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Expected graduation year 2026
* In your penultimate year of study
* Highly driven person who enjoys working in teams to develop complex solutions
* Exceptional interpersonal, communication, logical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Excellent organizational skills and ability to multitask
* Genuine interest in financial markets and macro-level economic trends
* Desire to ultimately work with external clients in a relationship building and sales capacity
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
* Highly inquisitive, focused and considerate
* Good judgment and discretion when working with confidential information
* Fluency in Swedish may be required; A second EU language is preferable but not essential.


**Application Deadline**
 3 November, 2024
   

  

*We will be filling our classes on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible before job postings close.*
**Join Us**
 At JPMorgan Chase, we're creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you're passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we're looking for you. For more than 200 years, we have been working with innovators, entrepreneurs, industry leaders and their families to help them achieve their unique ambitions, secure their legacies and make a difference in the world. That means providing meaningful, tailored advice now and across generations. The Private Bank helps clients plan, invest, borrow and bank to create the life and legacy they envision.
   

  

 We located in more than 17 offices across 11 countries in the Europe, Middle East and North Africa (EMEA) region. Guided by industry leaders, our teams deliver best-in-class ideas and insights for our clients around the world. J.P. Morgan was named 2021’s “Best Private Bank in the World” by Global Finance magazine and captured multiple EMEA awards by Euromoney, including “Best Private Banking Services Overall” in the United Kingdom, Italy, Egypt and Saudi Arabia” and “Best Private Banking Services for Mega High Net Worth Clients” in France, Italy, Israel, and the Middle East.
   

  

 See the Asset & Wealth Management CEO Letter here.
   

  

**What’s next?**
 Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
   

  

* To start the application, you will be prompted to enter your email address. Your email address will be used to create and maintain your profile so make sure it is one you will have long term access to.
+ Do not use an email address with “.edu” extension as doing so could result in delays receiving updates regarding your candidacy.

* After you confirm your application, we will review it to figure out whether you meet certain required qualifications.


 JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.
   

  

 Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.
   

  

**About Us**
 J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
   

  

 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. title: Scrum Master/Agil Projektledare
description:
Vi söker Scrum Master/Agil Projektledare till Myndighet inom det svenska kraftsystemet


Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Du kommer vara anställd av Centio Consulting Group AB och arbeta som konsult.


Tjänsten är på heltid, och säkerhetsprövning krävs


Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.

**Uppdraget**


Myndigheten är den som ansvarar för att elöverföringssystemet är säkert, miljöanpassat och kostnadseffektivt – i dag och i framtiden. Den drivs i form av ett statligt affärsverk, och har drygt 1400 medarbetare varav de flesta arbetar på huvudkontoret i Sundbyberg.

 **Myndigheten står inför en ökad digitalisering. Ett fokusområde är hur information om fysiska anläggningar hålls digitalt. Inom anläggnings- och affärssystemet IFS kommer en förflyttning ske och de har behov av att stärka upp teamet med en praktisk, kommunikativ och driven Scrum master eller motsvarande.**


Uppdraget innebär att som Scrum master/agil projektledare driva och strukturera arbetet som dels sker inom ramarna för ett projekt kopplat till framtagande av en ny anläggningsstruktur samt dels inom förvaltningsteamet mellan vilka ett nära samarbete finns.


Konsulten kommer att vara drivande och stötta teamet som jobbar iterativt och består av både representanter från verksamheten på Nät och IT. Konsulten är en del av ett team där behovsinsamling, strukturering av information, genomgång av arbetsflöden och utbildning ingår. Myndigheten genomför en förändringsresa inom digitalisering, där alla i sina respektive roller bidrar för att göra den upplevelsen så bra som möjligt för slutanvändarna.


Konsulten anpassar sitt arbetssätt och ambitionsnivå utifrån uppdragets specifika förutsättningar och jobbar i nära samarbete med andra roller i IT-förvaltningen samt i linjeorganisationen.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

  

* Sätta upp en struktur för hur man jobbar i Azure DevOps, anpassa Kanbantavlan så att det avspeglar hur myndigheten arbetar
* Säkra att korrekta kort finns på Kanbantavlan för respektive sprint nedbrutna på lagom nivå (Definition of Done, hur man ska testa funktioner/resultat, etc.), och med hjälp av teamen bryta ned så att det går att utföra på 3 veckor
* Följa upp och vid behov stötta i användandet av Azure DevOps
* Hålla i Stand-up och följa upp alla kort på Kanbantavlan
* Planera och leda kommande sprintar genom backlog refinenment
* Förbereda, genomföra demo/ säkerställa att ansvariga finns för de funktioner som ska visas
* Leda demo och tillsammans med PL/förvaltningsteamet genomföra retrospecitive
* Facilitera och delta i andra möten efter behov

 **Krav (OBS, obligatoriska)**


Högskole-/universitetsexamen minst 120p/180 hp inom systemvetenskap, alternativt motsvarande kompetens (med motsvarande kompetens menas erfarenhet av arbetsuppgifter enligt uppdragsbeskrivningen) förvärvad genom minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet
  

Certifierad som Scrum Master
  

Utbildning Azure DevOps
  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet att leda, planera och följa upp projekt/arbete inom IT-system eller digitala tjänster med hjälp av agila arbetssätt och metoder som Kanban, Scrum eller SAFe
  

Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från Azure DevOps

**Meriterande**

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete kopplat till affärssystem/ERP/asset management motsvarande IFS
  

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet arbete med anläggningsförvaltning, till exempel hos leverantör, entreprenör eller projektstöd





**Om oss**


Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.


Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.


Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.


För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.


Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Senior DevOps Engineer at CtrlPrint
  
At CtrlPrint, our vision is to simplify corporate reporting worldwide.
  
CtrlPrint is an international, fast growing SaaS company building the market leading
  
collaboration platform for corporate reporting projects. More than 1,000 customers entrust us
  
with their most important documents each year. Regardless of your size and sector, our
  
software as a service solution empowers you to manage changes collaboratively with you and
  
your wider team and creative resource, all in a secure environment.
  
We are now looking for talented, and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team in
  
Stockholm. We are a small, closely-knit team serving a well-established client base spread
  
internationally.
  
Are you looking for your next challenge in DevOps? Are you interested in DevOps and have
  
experience working with operations, deployment, and monitoring? You might just be the person
  
we are looking for, so please keep reading
  
The role
  
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, your role will be to bridge the gap between development and
  
operations, ensuring seamless integration and delivery of software while maintaining the
  
stability, reliability, and security of the infrastructure.
  
* Design, develop, and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines, ensuring smooth and efficient


deployment processes.
  
* Monitor system health, performance, and security, implementing best practices to


maintain high availability and reliability.
  
* Work closely with developers, QA, and IT teams to streamline operations and deliver


high-quality software solutions.
  
* Diagnose and resolve complex issues efficiently, identify root causes, and implement


effective solutions to enhance system reliability and performance.
  
* Maintain meticulous attention to detail in configuration management, documentation,


and ensuring consistency across environments to uphold system reliability and stability.
  
To be successful in this role / Preferred qualifications
  
* Have 3+ years in a DevOps role with a strong background.
* Experience or knowledge of DevOps in AWS with CloudFormation, Terraform, or similar


Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools.
  
* Ideally you have experience working with or knowledge of Jenkins, Bitbucket Pipelines


or GitLab CI/CD.
  
* Exceptional communication skills in English
* As a person, you are driven, self-motivated, and have a strong sense of responsibility.
* You enjoy working with great freedom to shape and develop not only your role but also


the organisation with a focus on DevOps.
  
* You are flexible, solution-oriented, and not afraid to share your ideas and take initiative.
* You are a team player who values good collaborations and ensures that you contribute


to a good working environment.
  
What we offer
  
Founded in 2001, CtrlPrint is a Swedish company with offices in Stockholm (HQ), Helsinki,
  
London and Sydney. In 2023 we were named a Gasell company by Dagens Industri and we
  
**established a position on Breakit:** s list of successful SaaS companies in Sweden.
  
We are an inclusive, respectful and inspired company where everyone plays a key part to our
  
success. We are sincere and transparent and always willing to learn and develop to stay
  
competitive, and are a successful company on a strong profitable growth trajectory. We offer
  
an attractive compensation and benefits plan as well as a flexible workplace.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Are you a newly graduate looking to kick-start your career in the exciting field of DevOps? We are launching an initiative to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. Our goal is to thrill our customers by delivering services they love and giving them a competitive edge, while building a "lean and mean" product development organization. Join our team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next. If you're passionate about fostering modern product development paradigms, inspiring change, shaping innovative technology, and building something entirely new, we want you on board!

 **What you will do:**

* Learn and grow: Design, implement, and manage cloud-based infrastructure solutions as part of an agile team, ensuring our tools and infrastructures are robust, scalable, and user-friendly.
* Collaborate: Work closely with development teams to solve infrastructure-related issues and support them in delivering high-quality solutions.
* Stay up to date: Keep yourself updated with industry-standard methodologies and emerging technologies.
* Contribute to the team: Participate in an agile team using Lean, Agile, and DevOps methodologies and tooling, contributing to continuous integration, delivery, and deployment capabilities.
 **The skills you bring:**

* Passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow in the field of cloud infrastructure management.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Basic understanding of cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, and their infrastructure management. We are working with GCP as our primary cloud provider and experience and certificates in GCP will be highly valued.
* Familiarity with DevOps principles and tools, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge or experience with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Senior DevOps Engineer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




 Are you passionate about building and optimising robust infrastructure solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge platforms and automation pipelines for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex CI/CD challenges and create impactful solutions with a focus on scalable, resilient infrastructure?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on DevOps and platform engineering, allowing you to dive deep into infrastructure design, data infrastructure, automation, and cloud-native technologies.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). The company is committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this, you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård), and private pension contributions.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure for CI/CD, automating deployment processes, and managing Kubernetes clusters and related cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure. You’ll be responsible for optimising development pipelines, infrastructure, data, and QA processes, as well as implementing best practices around monitoring, tracing, metrics, and alerts.
 



  





 A key aspect of your role will be enhancing the developer experience within the team and solving customers' infrastructure-related problems. You’ll advocate for solutions and, when appropriate, push for the adoption of the company’s own tools and frameworks. Your consultant-style approach will see you acting as a partner and support outside the customer environment.
 



  





**About you?** 




 Deep experience working with Kubernetes, with a strong focus on automation and infrastructure optimisation. You thrive in environments that require independence in learning and working and enjoy close collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 



  





 You have experience configuring and managing cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, as well as on-premise solutions. An automation-first mindset is crucial, and experience with Python or similar languages is a bonus. Leadership experience and strong communication skills are highly valued, as you'll mentor team members and interface with clients while contributing to the evolution of DevOps practices within the team.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role, and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specializing in software and infrastructure solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasizes collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



  





 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





  





*3 stage Interview Process* 




*Initial Chat* 




*Technical Discussion* 




*Final with CEO*

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
Come and join us! Oracle Consulting organization is responsible for delivering specialized consulting services to clients and supporting sales activities related to Oracle Cloud Services. We are the experts that other experts seek out for leading practices in Oracle Cloud with our deep know-how and proven expertise from implementing countless cloud journeys.
 



 If you’re an excellent communicator with a passion for empowering business innovation, this is your opportunity to stand out! We are looking for an experienced IaaS Cloud Consultant to help our customers design and implement our Oracle Cloud Infrastructure platform. We are looking for creative, pioneering, ambitious software and technology professionals who live and breathe cloud.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 As an Oracle Cloud Consultant, you will guide customers on their Cloud journey. Advising on how to best design, deploy and optimize their cloud infrastructure for high availability, reliability, performance and scale.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Provide advice and guidance to our customers and partners on best practices for their migration to Oracle Public Cloud. Become a trusted technical advisor to customers and solve complex Cloud Infrastructure and Networking challenges
* Work closely with customers, either from a technical or non-technical standpoint, to deliver a solution that fulfils or exceeds their requirements
* Engage with customers to ensure service needs are being met and deliverables perfectly fit Oracle’s high-quality standard
* Proactively maintain knowledge of Oracle’s current and future IaaS products/ solution offerings



  





  





**What You’ll Bring** 



* Relevant experience in Cloud migration projects with any Public Cloud technology (Oracle, Azure, AWS, Google), Oracle OCI would be a plus.
* Positive and structured approach, you can discuss implementation at both a business and technical level and thrive working in a dynamic environment.
* Experience moving customer’s workloads to Public Cloud
* Technical environment of the role: Cloud Security, Cloud Migration and Deployment, Database Skills, Networking Skills, DevOps, Servless Architecture, Container Architectures, Automation, Machine Learning and AI, OS Strong concepts (Linux), Computer Programming Languages Knowledge (Along with Java at least three of the following): PHP, Perl, Python, Node, Golang, Ruby, JS



  





  





**What We Offer** 




 We give you the freedom, skills, tools and technologies to craft your future. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain access to
 **immense learning experiences** 
 and you’ll always be backed-up by
 **Oracle’s impressive resources.** 



* Good work/life balance
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse Communities
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you outstanding
* An international culture that is vibrant, dynamic, and encouraging helping you reach your full potential

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör med intresse för teknik och att ständigt utvecklas? Vill du hjälpa våra kunder att göra världen lite bättre? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom exempelvis fordon, fintech, myndigheter, medtech och telekom. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av elkraftsystem till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla.
   

  

 Rollen som DevOps-ingenjör hos oss är en omväxlande roll, med arbete på olika nivåer, där du får en chans att delta i våra kunders DevOps-resa utifrån deras mognadsgrad.
   

  

**Matchar vi?**
 Vi söker dig som blir uttråkad av att göra samma sak två gånger och genast börjar hacka ihop en automatiserad lösning istället. Vi ser gärna att du har automatiserat något som absolut inte behövdes automatiseras! Kanske hemma?
   

  

 De som jobbar med DevOps på HiQ har ofta en kodtung utbildning och har jobbat som DevOps engineer i några år. Vi ser gärna att du har en liknande bakgrund, då vi oftast tar oss an Stockholms mer avancerade uppdrag.
   

  

**Checklist**
* Högskole-/Universitetsexamen inom datateknik, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annan relevant inriktning
* Minst 3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Det är ett stort plus om du har tidigare erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Scripting
* Säkerhet
* Monitorering
* CI/CD-tekniker
* Containeriseringsverktyg och molnlösningar
* Automation i produktionsmiljö med många noder
* IP-nätverk, VPN, DNS, lastbalanserare och brandväggar
* Seamless/automatiserade byggscript för release management i olika miljöer


 Vi ser också gärna att du tidigare byggt sofistikerad infrastruktur med en hög grad av automation och är en förespråkare av infrastructure-as-code.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Forma framtiden för vår digitala infrastruktur på Data & Analytics
* Optimera pipelines för CI/CD för våra Kubernetes-baserade tjänster
* Ha stort ansvar för att bygga, implementera och underhålla våra system


 Är du nyfiken på hur den här texten ska sluta? Kul! Vi gillar dig redan. Att vara nyfiken är viktigt för oss.
   

  

 På SBAB spelar nämligen rollen mindre roll. Att du är kunnig förväntar vi oss. Det viktiga är att du vill vara med och bidra till vår kultur, attityd och vårt sätt att vara. Och eftersom vi är lika många experter som medarbetare, behöver alla vara just nyfikna och intresserade av varandras olikheter. Vi lyssnar in och omvärderar kontinuerligt. Vi tror på mångfald, att olika perspektiv berikar och att du är en viktig framgångsfaktor. Fortfarande nyfiken? Välkommen!
   

  

 Att jobba som DevOps
   

  

 Vi söker en passionerad och erfaren DevOps Engineer som vill vara med och forma framtiden för vår digitala infrastruktur på Data & Analytics. Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjligheten att bidra med din expertis inom Microsoft SQL Server, Linux, Kubernetes, Docker, Python och private och public cloud-teknologier. I den här rollen blir du en central del av vårt team, där du får stort ansvar för att bygga, implementera och underhålla våra system. Du kommer även att samarbeta nära med utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa smidig integration, optimera SQL Server-miljöer, samt implementera och övervaka säkerhetsåtgärder.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:
   

  

* Designa, bygga och underhålla skalbara och pålitliga infrastrukturlösningar i molnet.
* Hjälpa till att optimera pipelines för continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) för våra Kubernetes-baserade tjänster.
* Hantera och optimera SQL Server-miljöer för att säkerställa hög prestanda och tillgänglighet, med speciellt fokus på våra testmiljöer.
* Utveckla och underhålla scripts och verktyg i Python och Powershell för automatisering och hantering av infrastrukturtjänster.
* Samverka med andra team för att säkerställa att infrastrukturen möter verksamhetens behov och framtida krav.


 Vi ser gärna att du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta som DevOps Engineer eller i en liknande roll. Du har djupgående kunskap och erfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server, inklusive installation, konfigurering, och optimering. Vidare har du gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med Linux-baserade system, containerisering och orkestrering med Docker och Kubernetes. Du har också erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnplattformar som Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud. Då kommunikation på svenska är en viktig del i vår vardag är det viktigt att din svenska är god i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Bra på att prioritera
* Helhetsperspektiv
* Kvalitetsmedveten
* Leveranssäker
* Nyfiken


 Annars då?
   

  

 Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 We are launching an exciting DevOps initiative that aims to overhaul how we deliver solutions, using As-a-Service on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) as our vehicle. You will be challenged, but you won't be alone. You will be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
